desc: Wallet address and DAO token balance. This is, respectively, your identity and your agency within the DAO

Current state of a proposal, following standard conventions. Block number is used to retrieve user's votes and quorum. The snapshot is performed at the end of the block when the proposal is made. Hence, voting for this proposal starts at the beginning of the following block. For a deeper explanation of verifying proposals and understanding this metadata, see the About page.
Cast a vote with explanation. You can copy the proposalID under Get Proposal Details. See About page for further explanation.

Delegate votes from the sender to delegatee. This must be done at least once before a user can vote. By default, token balance does not account for voting power (it makes token transfers cheaper). The downside is that it requires users to delegate to themselves in order to activate checkpoints and have their voting power tracked.
